content.rendered:
Ahmedabad Dwarka Weekend Package

Home » India » Gujarat » Ahmedabad Dwarka Weekend Package

Tour Overview

Dwarka, land of Lord Krishna is one of the most acclaimed spiritual cities in India and is home to Dwarkadhish Temple (One of the Char Dham Pilgrimages in India). Dwarkadhish Temple also called Jagat Mandir is one of the prime destinations of Krishna worshippers and attracts millions of tourists from all across the globe. Our 2 Days and 3 Nights long Ahmedabad Dwarka Weekend Tour Package takes you through various temples and the picturesque sightseeing destinations adorning the city. We also offer you the proper time to try your bargaining skills in the textile city of Ahmedabad.

Ahmedabad Dwarka Weekend Tour Itinerary Package

Day 1 :Ahmedabad – Jamnagar – Dwarka

On reaching Ahmedabad early morning, you will be driven towards Dwarka en-route which you can visit Bala Hanuman Temple and Jamnagar. Bala Hanuman Temple is pretty popular among tourists and locals as this is the place where you can witness continuous enchanting prayers of Lord Ram. It is said that the enchanting started in the year 1964 and since then it is still continued. The temple has been enlisted in the Guinness Book of World Record due to this continuous enchanting. After paying homage to this sacred shrine continue driving towards Dwarka. On reaching Dwarka, you will be transferred to one of our Pre-listed hotels. Check-into the hotel, unwind yourself and then relax for a few hours. Later in the evening, set out to participate in the Aarti ceremony and do the philosophy of Lord Krishna. Return to the hotel, enjoy the Gujarati Thali in dinner which will be then followed by a relaxing overnight stay.

Day 2 :Dwarka – Bet Dwarka – Dwarka

Wake up little early today and get ready to do the philosophy of Lord Krishna at Dwarkadhish Temple and also witness the charm of morning Aarti ceremony at the temple. After completing the puja rituals and Aarti ceremony, you will be dropped back to the hotel for having a lavish breakfast. Post breakfast you will be dropped at Jetty from where you board the boat to reach Beyt Dwarka.

Dwarkadhish TempleAlso called as Beyt Shankhoddar, Beyt Dwarka is located almost 5 kilometers away from the Okha junction and 30 kilometers ahead of Dwarka. According to Hindu mythology, this is the dwelling place of Lord Krishna where he had spent many years with his family at the time when he was ruling at Dwarka. Another story says that this is the place where Lord Vishnu killed the demon Shankhasura and this is how the place holds a great religious significance. After a few hours, you will be taken back to Jetty for catching the boat to reach Dwarka. While returning back to Dwarka, make a halt at Nageshwar Mahadev Temple which is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Continue driving towards Dwarka and on reaching there unwind yourself in the hotel room, enjoy dinner and then go for a sound sleep.

Day 3 :Dwarka – Ahmedabad

Start your day with spirituality and visit the popular Rukmini Temple which is dedicated to the wife of Lord Krishna. Post a scrumptious breakfast, pack your bags and then our representative will take you to Ahmedabad Airport and Railway Station. Ahmedabad Dwarka sightseeing tour with us concludes here.

Price Details

Tour Name Ahmedabad Dwarka Weekend Tour Package
Duration 3 Days / 2 Nights
Destinations Ahmedabad - Jamnagar - Dwarka
Tour Price On Request

  • +91-971 1616 316

    Holiday Your Way with Namaste India Trip!

    Filling out the information form provided allows you to receive the best budget-friendly customized itinerary in just a few hours.

    • We assure the privacy of your contact data.

    • This data will only be used by our team to contact you and no other purposes.

    Trip Highlights

    • Visiting the popular Bala Hanuman Temple.
    • Paying homage at Dwarkadhish Temple which is also called as Jagat Temple. Participate in the flag changing ceremony which occurs thrice a day.
    • Visiting Krishna Temple which was constructed almost 500 years back by Shri Vallabhacharya.
    • Visiting the famous Rukmini Devi Temple which is renowned for its architecture especially the external carvings.

    Package Inclusions

    • All car / taxi / cab service
    • Accommodation as per itinerary
    • Meals as per itinerary
    • Driver allowance, parking fees, fuel charges
    • Pick up and drop off service

    Package Exclusions

    • Medical and travel insurance
    • Any expense of personal nature
    • Monument entrance fees
    • Tipping, phone bills, etc.
    • Anything not mentioned in the inclusions section

    FAQs for Ahmedabad Dwarka Package

    Q. When Is The Best Time To Go To Dwarka?

    A. The winter season lasts from November to February. The maximum temperature in the season is 34°C, and the lowest temperature is 9°C. The weather is usually pleasant, with a cool breeze. It is thought to be the best time to visit Dwarka for sightseeing.

    Q. What Makes Dwarka Unique?

    A. Dwarka, a holy Hindu pilgrimage town, is famous for the Dwarkadhish Temple, as well as other historical and religious sites. Thousands of devotees from all over the world come here every year during Janmashtami (the anniversary of Krishna's birth) to partake in elaborate festivities.

    Q. What Foods Are Famous In Dwarka?

    A. While visiting, a lavish Gujarati Thali is a must. This delectable platter includes Roti, Dal or Kadhi, rice, and vegetable curries. You can also try the well-known Khichdi.

    Q. When Is The Best Time Of Year To Visit Ahmedabad?

    A. From November to February Winters are the best time to visit Ahmedabad because the weather is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for sightseeing. During this time of year, the maximum temperature rises to 35 degrees Celsius and the minimum falls to 12 degrees Celsius.

    Q. Why Should One Go To Ahmedabad?

    A. Ahmedabad is a destination for heritage tourism. There are tourist attractions celebrating India's history and culture. Visiting the famous Sabarmati ashram and Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel museum will give you a better understanding of India's independence strategy.
